page.title: 06WILDLIFE IN BRANSTON
page.content: Branston is a flat farming landscape, so there are few places where interesting wild plants grow. We do get lots of wildlife in Branston like:partridges, pheasant, ducks and rabbits. We also get lots of predators like: foxes, weasels, sparrow hawks and sometimes kestrels. However farmers have changed the landscape by chopping down hedges and trees to make bigger fields and draining fields to make them very dry. As well as that farmers are using crop-sprays and poisons. Although these kill pests they also kill less harmful animals like rabbits and mice. Because this is happening plants and insects are being killed off, which affects bird life. Now farmers are giving up land to create reservoirs for water birds and are planting shrubs and trees to create new habitats.
